description.narrative:
- Number of bills, laws, regulations, policies, or practices that better conform to international legal standards and best practices with ICNL assistance
- Number of bills, laws, regulations, amendments, or provisions that would violate civil society freedoms as proposed but whose offending provisions were defeated with ICNL assistance
- Number of CSOs and other stakeholders that undertake activities to promote reform following ICNL assistance
STRATEGIC OBJECTIVE 2. Empowering local partners to advocate for national-level laws and policies that protect the freedoms of association, expression, and assembly

organisation.narrative: The International Center for Not-for-Profit Law

mailing-address.narrative: 1126 16th Street, NW, Suite 400 Washington, DC 20036 USA

title.narrative: CSOs and other stakeholders that receive ICNL assistance to build their capacity to advance legal reform

comment.narrative: Baseline data taken from from ICNL Actuals from July 2018 - June 2019, the initial year of reporting
The target is for calendar year 2020.

This indicator only covers stakeholders in the field of advocacy; it does not include all ICNL stakeholders for non-advocacy work.
